DOC.HEAD: 32 Killed, 40 Injured in Pre-Dawn Tour Bus Crash
Eds: LEADS throughout to UPDATE with 32 killed, 40 injured, quotes, details. No pickup
DOC.TEXT: Two tour buses crashed head-on before dawn Friday on a rainy stretch of the Pacific Highway between Sydney and Brisbane, leaving at least 32 people dead in Australia's worst road crash ever, police said. New South Wales state police superidentent Merv Lane said some passengers still were trapped inside one of the coaches more than five hours after the 3:30 a.m. accident in Fredrickton, about 280 north of Sydney. Forty people were hospitalized. The crash occurred two months after a bus and a tractor-trailer collided at nearby Grafton, killing 20 people. The Pacific Highway is considered one of Australia's most dangerous roads. Witnesses said the two buses involved in Friday's accident were embedded in one another. Television footage showed bodies lining both sides of the road. ``It's dreadful, there are people hanging from the bus windows,'' said Marion Thomas, who lives near the scene and was awakened by the sound of the crash. ``It was a terrible explosion. It's a terrible sight.'' It was not immediately known if any foreigners were aboard the buses, though police, which downgraded the original death toll from 40, said it was believed all aboard were Australian. Police are investigating the cause of the accident.
